item.title: Mt. Pollux Hike & Picnic
item.description:
Mt. Pollux Hike & Picnic

If you're on campus, take a break and recharge with us during mid-semester break! We will visit Mt. Pollux to soak in the views during golden hour :)Light snacks and refreshments provided. Bring your own picnic blanket!

RSVP REQUIRED BY OCT 10TH (only 11 spots available if you need transportation).

If you have any questions or concerns, email carc@amherst.edu. 

From Tuesday, October 15, 2024 4:15 PM to 5:45 PM EDT at Mt. Pollux.

item.title: Food Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting
item.description:
Food Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting

Come join the Food Justice Alliance for our weekly meeting! At our general meetings, we might discuss food justice issues, plan key events like collaborations with the Book & Plow Farm, cook or bake together, coordinate the Food Recovery Program @ Val or other volunteer opportunities, and much more. Come join us in Chapin 204 at 8pm every week!

From Wednesday, October 16, 2024 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM EDT at Chapin 204.

item.title: Fencing Club Practice
item.description:
Fencing Club Practice

The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

From Thursday, October 17, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM EDT at Alumni Gym (Middleton Gym).
item.author: mammothfencing@gmail.com (Amherst College Fencing Club)

item.title: Amherst Cricket Club Practices
item.description:
Amherst Cricket Club Practices
Dear Cricketers,
 
This semester's practices are scheduled on the following times at a weekly cadence in Coolidge Cage (Alumni Gym aka Tennis Courts):
  • Thursday 8-10 pm
  • Saturday 3-5 pm
So, the INTRO-meeting is (12th Sept) THIS THURSDAY 8-10 pm!!! Equipment & Snacks/Drinks Covered!
 
Before that, as per the Amherst College rules, please fill out the waiver below so that we can start the ball rolling! And, I have also sent all of you invites on the Hub to join the club, so please accept the invite there to stay posted! (GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/97352198/c7Az2Nim)

How do I sign the waiver?

Link: https://risk-management.mtholyoke.edu/waivers/login.php

Once logged in, you should click on Waiver Form in the top left-hand corner, and then select the following from the drop-down menus:

College: Amherst College
Activity Type: Student Group
Activity Name: Amherst College Cricket Club

After that you will be prompted to sign and fill in your background information!

Thank you so much for your support and patience throughout this!

Take care,

Founder & President of Cricket Club

From Thursday, October 17, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EDT at Amherst Alumni Gym (Coolidge Cage).
item.author: dmavani25@amherst.edu (Amherst College Cricket Club)

item.title: Fall Quizbowl Tournament @ MIT (10/19)
item.description:
Fall Quizbowl Tournament @ MIT (10/19)

We'll be going to a quizbowl tournament at MIT on Saturday, October 19, which is the weekend after fall break. The tournament is geared toward newer collegiate players who haven't had much exposure to quizbowl, so it's a great fit for anyone regardless of experience. We'd love to see you there! Feel free to mark that you're coming on the Hub, but please also fill out this Google form.

From Saturday, October 19, 2024 6:30 AM to 7:30 PM EDT at MIT.
item.author: mzheng27@amherst.edu (Quiz Bowl)

item.title: Mt. Lincoln - Lafayette Hike 10/19
item.description:
Mt. Lincoln - Lafayette Hike 10/19

Join us for an exciting adventure as we drive to the base of Mt. Lincoln-Lafayette in New Hampshire and embark on a summit hike! All transportation and meals are included, so you can focus on enjoying the journey and taking in the stunning views.

This is a DIFFICULT HIKE: ~8 miles of climbing and descending a total of 7,000 feet.

 

From Saturday, October 19, 2024 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM EDT at Mount Lafayette Trailhead.
item.author: acoc@amherst.edu (Outing Club)

item.title: Weekly Discretionary
item.description:
Weekly Discretionary

Join the AAS Budgetary Committee (BC) to request funding from the AAS Discretionary Fund for any student activities you wish to put on! Prior to arriving, please review the funding policies and put your name, the club you are representing, and what you are asking for here under the appropriate week. Please forward any questions to budgetary@amherst.edu or reach out to your BC Representatives listed here. 

From Monday, October 21, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM EDT at Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall.
item.location: Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall

item.title: Fencing Club Practice
item.description:
Fencing Club Practice

The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

From Tuesday, October 22, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM EDT at Alumni Gym (Middleton Gym).
item.author: mammothfencing@gmail.com (Amherst College Fencing Club)

item.title: Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting
item.description:
Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting

Gather one and all to practice your sword (among other weapons) combat against friend and foe alike, SAFELY. To create great spectacles and drama is terrific on its own but what if you added WEAPONS (AND SAFETY). If the likes of the Princess Bride or Pirates of the Caribbean have ever gotten your blood rushing and riled up your instinct to pick up a roughly sword-shaped object, then this is the place for you to indulge those desires, SAFELY. So join us if you dare, but only if you are prepared for a fun (and safe) time...

From Tuesday, October 22, 2024 5:30 PM to 7:00 PM EDT at Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending).
item.location: Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending)
item.author: mhauschildt25@amherst.edu (Theatrical Choreography Club)

item.title: Queer and Questioning
item.description:
Queer and Questioning

Do you have questions about queerness? Are you exploring your identity? Are you in need of a space to discuss anything gender and/or sexuality related with no labels involved? Then stop by our student-led support group at Keefe 203, every Tuesday at 7:30 pm. All sessions are private and do not require regular involvement! No college staff/faculty will be present during the sessions.

From Tuesday, October 22, 2024 7:30 PM to 8:30 PM EDT at Queer Resource Center.

item.description:

Pop in to Student Engagement and Leadership every Wednesday for popcorn and conversation! A special topping every week, good company, and a time to ask questions about your organizations. We can't wait to see you!

From Wednesday, October 23, 2024 3:00 PM to 5:00 PM EDT at Keefe Campus Center 102.
item.author: sel@amherst.edu (Student Engagement and Leadership)

item.title: Media and Mental Health
item.description:
Media and Mental Health

We are constantly on various media platforms, such as news outlets, instagram, tiktok, youtube, fizz, streaming platforms, X and more! And what you see can influence, both positively and negatively, your mental health and overall wellness. How do you build healthy habits and mindsets (whether it's scaling back or adding more) around media consumption? Join us in a two part series where you can connect with staff from CARC and CCMH as well as your peers around this question. First session will focus on learning and discussion, and the second session will focus on application. Soft RSVP to let us know you're interested!! 

 

Light snacks and refreshments will be provided. Email carc@amherst.edu for any accessibility questions or concerns. 

From Wednesday, October 23, 2024 4:30 PM to 5:30 PM EDT at Wellbeing Makerspace.

item.title: Food Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting

Come join us in Chapin 204 at 8pm every week!

From Wednesday, October 23, 2024 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM EDT at Chapin 204.
item.author: acfoodjustice@gmail.com (Food Justice Alliance)

item.title: Health, Poverty, and Homelessness -- Speaker Event with Amherst Community Connections
item.description:
Health, Poverty, and Homelessness -- Speaker Event with Amherst Community Connections

Hwei-Ling Greeney, the Founder and Executive Director of Amherst Community Connections, will be speaking on her approach to improving the health of the homeless and poor population in the town of Amherst. ACC is a a local nonprofit dedicated to raising awareness of the personal, social and economic ravages of homelessness and organizes the community to engage in long-term, coordinated solutions that emphasize homelessness prevention, rapid re-housing, affordable housing and appropriate supportive services. 

Learn how to get involved with local efforts to stop homelessness and help those below the poverty line. 

From Wednesday, October 23, 2024 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM EDT at Lipton Lecture Hall, Science Center.
item.author: ac.publichealthcollab@gmail.com (Public Health Collaborative)

item.title: Hub Happy Hour

Hub Happy Hour

From Thursday, October 24, 2024 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM EDT at Keefe Campus Center 102 .

item.title: Fencing Club Practice
item.description:
Fencing Club Practice

The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

From Thursday, October 24, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM EDT at Alumni Gym (Middleton Gym).

item.title: Poetry Parlor
item.description:
Poetry Parlor

The Poetry Club is profoundly proud to present the Prose and Poetry Parlor! Come share and talk about your writing — of any form or style — in an open, supportive, and informal space. We will host open mics, workshop-style discussions, low-stakes writing challenges — the sky's the limit! With these biweekly gatherings, we hope to provide an environment that encourages and connects the writing community on campus. Come visit us at Pemberton Lounge!

From Thursday, October 24, 2024 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM EDT at Pemberton Lounge.
item.author: thepoetryclub@amherst.edu (The Poetry Club)

item.title: Study Away 101
item.description:
Study Away 101

Are you considering studying away for a semester (or two!)? We'll be covering the basics of the process for both international and domestic programs, including what programs are available, financial considerations, when to start applications, and more. Students are expected to attend this info session before making an appointment with a GEO advisor.

From Tuesday, October 22, 2024 3:30 PM to Monday, October 28, 2024 4:30 PM EDT at Lipton Lecture Hall, Science Center.
item.author: geo@amherst.edu (Global Education Office)

item.title: Study Away 101
item.description:
Study Away 101

Are you considering studying away for a semester (or two!)? We'll be covering the basics of the process for both international and domestic programs, including what programs are available, financial considerations, when to start applications, and more. Students are expected to attend this info session before making an appointment with a GEO advisor.

From Friday, October 18, 2024 4:00 PM to Monday, October 28, 2024 5:00 PM EDT at Classroom 211, Frost Library .
item.author: geo@amherst.edu (Global Education Office)

item.title: Media and Mental Health
item.description:
Media and Mental Health

We are constantly on various media platforms, such as news outlets, instagram, tiktok, youtube, fizz, streaming platforms, X and more! And what you see can influence, both positively and negatively, your mental health and overall wellness. How do you build healthy habits and mindsets (whether it's scaling back or adding more) around media consumption? Join us in a two part series where you can connect with staff from CARC and CCMH as well as your peers around this question. First session will focus on learning and discussion, and the second session will focus on application.  

Light snacks and refreshments will be provided. Email carc@amherst.edu for any accessibility questions or concerns. 

From Monday, October 28, 2024 4:30 PM to 5:30 PM EDT at Wellbeing Makerspace.

item.title: Study Away 101
item.description:
Study Away 101

We'll be covering the basics of the process for both international and domestic programs, including what programs are available, financial considerations, when to start applications, and more. Students are expected to attend this info session before making an appointment with a GEO advisor.

item.title: Fencing Club Practice
item.description:
Fencing Club Practice

The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

From Tuesday, October 29, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM EDT at Alumni Gym (Middleton Gym).
item.author: mammothfencing@gmail.com (Amherst College Fencing Club)

item.title: Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting
item.description:
Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting

Gather one and all to practice your sword (among other weapons) combat against friend and foe alike, SAFELY. To create great spectacles and drama is terrific on its own but what if you added WEAPONS (AND SAFETY). If the likes of the Princess Bride or Pirates of the Caribbean have ever gotten your blood rushing and riled up your instinct to pick up a roughly sword-shaped object, then this is the place for you to indulge those desires, SAFELY. So join us if you dare, but only if you are prepared for a fun (and safe) time...

From Tuesday, October 29, 2024 5:30 PM to 7:00 PM EDT at Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending).
item.location: Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending)
item.author: mhauschildt25@amherst.edu (Theatrical Choreography Club)

item.title: Queer and Questioning
item.description:
Queer and Questioning

Do you have questions about queerness? Are you exploring your identity? Are you in need of a space to discuss anything gender and/or sexuality related with no labels involved? Then stop by our student-led support group at Keefe 203, every Tuesday at 7:30 pm. All sessions are private and do not require regular involvement! No college staff/faculty will be present during the sessions.

From Tuesday, October 29, 2024 7:30 PM to 8:30 PM EDT at Queer Resource Center (Keefe 213).

Come join us in Chapin 204 at 8pm every week!

item.title: Amherst Cricket Club Practices
item.description:
Amherst Cricket Club Practices
Dear Cricketers,
 
This semester's practices are scheduled on the following times at a weekly cadence in Coolidge Cage (Alumni Gym aka Tennis Courts):
  • Thursday 8-10 pm
  • Saturday 3-5 pm
So, the INTRO-meeting is (12th Sept) THIS THURSDAY 8-10 pm!!! Equipment & Snacks/Drinks Covered!
 
Before that, as per the Amherst College rules, please fill out the waiver below so that we can start the ball rolling! And, I have also sent all of you invites on the Hub to join the club, so please accept the invite there to stay posted! (GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/97352198/c7Az2Nim)

How do I sign the waiver?

Link: https://risk-management.mtholyoke.edu/waivers/login.php

Once logged in, you should click on Waiver Form in the top left-hand corner, and then select the following from the drop-down menus:

College: Amherst College
Activity Type: Student Group
Activity Name: Amherst College Cricket Club

After that you will be prompted to sign and fill in your background information!

Thank you so much for your support and patience throughout this!

Take care,

Founder & President of Cricket Club

From Thursday, October 31, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EDT at Amherst Alumni Gym (Coolidge Cage).
item.author: dmavani25@amherst.edu (Amherst College Cricket Club)

item.title: Shabbat Dinner
item.description:
Shabbat Dinner

Please join us for Shabbat Dinner every Friday night in the Friedmann Room (second floor of Keefe Campus Center)! We provide a catered meal from a local restaurant, bakery challah, dessert, and some lovely Jewish conversation. Please contact hillel@amherst.edu or scolt@amherst.edu with questions.

From Friday, November 1, 2024 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM EDT at Friedmann Room, Keefe Campus Center.

item.title: Poetry Parlor
item.description:
Poetry Parlor

The Poetry Club is profoundly proud to present the Prose and Poetry Parlor! Come share and talk about your writing — of any form or style — in an open, supportive, and informal space. We will host open mics, workshop-style discussions, low-stakes writing challenges — the sky's the limit! With these biweekly gatherings, we hope to provide an environment that encourages and connects the writing community on campus. Come visit us at Pemberton Lounge!

From Thursday, November 7, 2024 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM EST at Pemberton Lounge.
